text: we've started in this book with
understanding your strengths and
weaknesses understanding your passions
trying to filter out conventional wisdom
and peer pressure so you can actually
focus on who you are but those will only
get you so far you have to take one big
additional step which is you have to
understand yourself further and what I
mean by that is you need to understand
your story and your life what I ask
people to do is first of all write down
the facts of their life now everybody
can do that right I was born a certain
place my parents did the following
things I grew up I went to high school
brothers and sisters and just write out
the facts second step for is is I point
out to people and ask them to think
about the narrative that they attach to
that story everyone whether they realize
it or not puts a spin a narrative on
their life story and for most of us we
are taught through most of of our life
to put what I'd call the success
narrative on our life story how we
Triumph persevered what we learned it
all worked out okay it had a happy
ending it may be about adversity and how
I how I had setbacks but it usually is a
story about me prevailing there's a
third story then and that I would call
your failure narrative it is a story uh
usually based on uh traumas in your life
setbacks in your life the punchline to
that story is usually in your head I'm
not good enough I can't do something I'm
afraid this is not such a happy story
and it seldom is one that you
tell but it's there in your head whether
you are aware of it or not and what I
try to do with people is get them to
write down their own failure narrative
and I'm not trying to do that to get
them to stop having a failure narrative
because I won't be able to do that won't
work but to get people to be aware of it
because normally if you're in a job or
you're in a career and you're struggling
that struggle is more often than not not
just connected to your skills it's more
likely connected to your doubt about
yourself your
insecurities uh which normally relates
to it something that happened in your
life the only reason to do this is not
because I'm trying to be a psychoanalyst
it's to figure out why you do
what you do my purpose is to get you
started on a path with a number of
exercises you can do and action steps so
you start understanding yourself better
it is essential part of Reaching Your
Potential and doing what you're really
meant to do
